So one star off for needing warranty attention, but high marks for making things right when they went wrong. Just make sure if you need help to avoid HP and go to Google.

Reviews.Title: Meets my needs
Reviews.Author: Tulla Bell "Bell"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this device and I have to admit I am loving it.  It meets my daily needs.  I find it to be quite responsive and the screen is bright and clear.  I like the fact that it is light, easy to transport around, and is a perfect size.  The keyboard is nice and having the speakers underneath the keyboard makes things sound so much better.  I am glad I made this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Better overall experince than a tablet
Reviews.Author: B Hoov
Reviews.Content: The design, build, and intricacies of this computer make it a vastly superior experience than a tablet (of any operating system- android, iOS, or windows). The design of the HP is worth the extra $30 as opposed to Samsung or Acer. The trackpad and the keyboard are fantastic for the money, and the speakers are much better than an other computer I've owned.The operating system, while limited, is smooth and fast. I wish Google could better integrate adobe PDF's and Dropbox, but overall a fantastic OS for the price. Between the build and the OS it is my go to computer while traveling!

Reviews.Title: This chromebook has the best display.  Love its robust connection to youtube.
Reviews.Author: Francis Fung "JULIA DEVENDORF"
Reviews.Content: I owned many chrome devices.  This has the best display.  Easy to set up like all chrome devices.  At first the touch pad appears to be unresponsive.  After some experimentation, the best solution is to connect it to a remote mouse.  This chromebook responds to mouse control beautifully.  I like most about this one is its robust connection to youtube.  I can play through my playlist without interruption  of connection wheras other chrome devices tend to lost connection frequently.  This one works like a charm.  I now use this exclusively to chromecast youtube program to my TV without interruption as I play through my playlist from beginning to end.10/23/2013 updateThis chromebook seems to chromecast better than other chrome devices. It works seemlessly in casting youtube, that is very important for me. I wonder if others have similar experiences.

Reviews.Title: Problems with charger and lame customer support
Reviews.Author: Kurt Biddle
Reviews.Content: I received an email from Amazon a month after buying this Chromebook that the manufacturer was recalling the charger and in the meantime we should not use the charger provided. I was told it was okay to use any micro-USB charger (such as a Samsung phone charger) until they solved the problem. The problem with this is it very slowly charges the Chromebook and the Chromebook must be turned off or it will not charge at all. Neither HP nor Chromebook contacted me. I contacted them and they said they would update me with a solution later. Three months later they sent out a replacement charger. Two months later the charger breaks and will not charge. We call customer service and they tell me sounds like I need another charger. But they will have to get back to me in 48 hours. I'm not sure where to buy the appropriate charger as a replacement. I wouldn't buy this computer again because of these issues. The Chromebook itself works fine, but it's nothing without being able to get power to it.

Reviews.Title: Beautifully designed but unfortunately very slow.
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned, this is probably the most aesthetically pleasing Chromebook in the market right now. The keyboard is really easy to type with (Probably one of the best I've used, and that's saying something for a sub-$300 computer) and I really like how the sound comes out through the keyboards, rather than through slots on the side or on the bottom of the machine.However, I have two issues with this machine, one major, the second a minor inconvenience: One, the performance is really quite dreadful. Basic tasks like running YouTube videos or Netflix really stressed this Chromebook. For instance, if you're watching a video and decide to skip around tabs, the audio will stutter relentlessly. Two, the mouse is simply dreadful. It's incredibly difficult to use and get used to.In short, it's a gorgeous looking machine (Which may be enough to convince users like me to go for the purchase), but the performance wasn't quite as convincing.

Reviews.Title: Google needs to hire some design engineer.
Reviews.Author: anger
Reviews.Content: Worst charger design in the world and the recall of them makes my point.We are on the third charger and it broke today. What testing they did to make sure this garbage last more than a month with normal use is beyond me.Good thing i got a warranty for this crap. Best $50 I spent and if you are buying the chromebook make sure you do the same.

Reviews.Title: The charger barely works.
Reviews.Author: Christ
Reviews.Content: The first one I had wouldn't charged so I returned it for another one. It worked for about two weeks and now I have to toy with the charger to try to get it to work. I would go with something with a better charger.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Ricky Reed
Reviews.Content: TL;WR- Knew what I was getting into going into the purchase. Does exactly what it was designed to do and does it extremely well. Crisp screen, excellent battery life, solid build, decent keyboard and a nice track-pad. Love it.I ordered the device after waiting for them to come back in stock across Amazon and the Google Play Store. I originally was holding out for a red accented device, but decided the blue would work and put in my order and spent the rest of the week of shipping scouring YouTube and other tech sites for some reviews and hands-on with the device to curb my anticipation.Upon arrival and discarding the elaborate packaging, you're faced with the device, which is absolutely gorgeous in regards to the outer aesthetics of the machine. The white gloss definitely reminds me of my old Macbook and the minimal approach to the outer hardware with the accents really makes it stand out and is nothing short of eyecandy.Once you open it up and turn the device on the screen quality immediately jumps out at you. Without getting into the specifications, the screen absolutely puts any other device I've used in this price-range to shame. Bright and crisp display, vibrant colors, absolutely satisfied with the display of the device.Audio on the device is superb, as well, which is surprising to me because out of all the reviews I watched and read I missed the fact that the speakers are not visible from the outside of the machine and is located under the keyboard. To my surprise, the sound quality is incredible; it's extremely full sounding, has none of that hollow or echo-pitch to it, and scales the volume quite well.Battery life has been great. I've been getting around 6 hours on the dot since the machine has arrived with regular use of browsing the web, document editing, and movie viewing.My major concern with the device was that it was my first Chromebook and the learning curve. Despite my concerns the learning curve was non-existent aside from the minor keyboard switches and swatches.My wife and daughter both love the machine, and we are already planning a second purchase. I'll be a Chromebook/ChromeOS fan moving forward; this device definitely converted my household, at least.

Reviews.Title: serious charging and warranty issues
Reviews.Author: techgeek007
Reviews.Content: The HP Chromebook 11 has a lot to like: a great screen, terrific form factor, and a beautiful appearance.  But the unit has a SERIOUS charging system issue anda complete lack of acceptable Product Support. After 2 months, the charging system on this laptop has completely stopped working. And that's after waiting several weeks for the replacement charger to arrive, as the charger that originally shipped with the unit melted and almost caught fire. In my case I've owned a HP Chromebook 11 for four months, and it has been non-functioning for two of those months.  I have now been waiting 6 WEEKS for a replacement laptop to arrive, as the laptop is "under warranty", and Google is supposedly waiting for "replacement units to arrive."  There must be tens of thousands (or more) of defective Chromebook 11s. The slow response for a replacement from Google is very troubling, as the Google Play Store presently has plenty of stock of every color of the HP Chromebook 11s.  It may take another public relations fiasco or a class action lawsuit on this laptop for HP and Google to address this complete lack of Product Support. IN THE MEANTIME, DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL-- PLEASE SAVE YOURSELF THE FRUSTRATION and look elsewhere for a Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: wont power up
Reviews.Author: Tarrant hencz
Reviews.Content: Have had nothing but trouble with it, wont start have to keep opening up and unhooking battery to get it to power up.

Reviews.Title: My go-to at-home device
Reviews.Author: S. Moestl "S. Moestl"
Reviews.Content: I should have bought one a long time ago!  I didn't realize how incredibly convenient it is to have a laptop that's so very lightweight and easy to carry.  The pads on the base give a great grip for carrying, too.I'm using it for almost all at-home computing, and use Google docs on it very frequently.  My kids use it all the time - it's much easier for them, too, being so lightweight.  Also I love that I can charge all my devices with the one micro-USB charger.A few of the negatives that aren't as well known:- No delete key!  It's actually amazing how frequently it's possible to avoid it (using backspace, etc), but sometimes not having a delete key is a hassle.- No home/end keys.  Yes, there are key combinations to substitute.  It's a bit of a hassle since I'm so used to these keys on all other laptops.Also, performance with a lot of tabs open is a little sluggish. But even given all this, I'd get another in a heartbeat if this one was lost or stolen.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: Michal Lusiak
Reviews.Content: Nice shape, awesome screen, dead without net but it is the way it was designed. With the parameters is still cheaper than many 10'' tablets - worth the money ! Logitech hardware works at start - any logitech mouse using universal receiver and c270 HD webcam. BTW, you receive 100GB of google drive for 2 years and 60 days of access to google music.

Reviews.Title: H P Chromebook 11
Reviews.Author: Dionne Coburn
Reviews.Content: I know nothing of computer!!  This chromebook was sooooo easy to get started!!!!  I love it!  Great product!  Anyone can do it!!  Dionne

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed with Hp
Reviews.Author: Chih-Hsuan Yu
Reviews.Content: Extremely poor quality. Run slow, quits all the time, can't do anything with it, false advertisements (can't exchange chargers with phone).

Reviews.Title: Im a Mac guy and this rocks
Reviews.Author: Rj Masterson
Reviews.Content: Ok, it costs about 1/5 the price of a mac and about the same as an ipad. Very light, very fast, great battery life, I can charge it from my car lighter and its as intuitive a s a Mac. Baby i'm amazed.

Reviews.Title: Great PC
Reviews.Author: Calcus
Reviews.Content: Bought this for myself, and lo and behold, my daughter took it for herself on her way to college!  It is a really reliable machine, and now I am off to buy another!  Very sleek piece!

Reviews.Title: Great product. I regret I don't buy it soon enough.
Reviews.Author: Kus Man
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised by the quality & experience this chromebook gave.First the quality,I'm abused by the quietness (no fan) of this chromebook, I think I could never get used to noisy notebook again.The screen were great, very light weight, and thinExperience.Simply wow. Why don't google create this chromebook 10 year earlier?

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my Chromebook!
Reviews.Author: Bridget M. Cunningham "Bridget1777"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to take on a trip overseas and it travels very well!  I almost bought a tablet instead, but I wanted an actual keyboard.  For the money, you really can't beat it.  There are some things it can't do, but I knew that before I bought it, so no surprises there.  I use it mostly for email, word processing, browsing and picture organization.  It's plenty quick and it looks sleek, too!  All in all, it's a great gadget!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what I need
Reviews.Author: Larry Ruzich
Reviews.Content: I've had mine about 2 months now and love the Chromebook experience. I watch video on Netflix and other sites, write e-mails, and check FaceBook etc. For those purposes, it can't be beat. If I run out of time in the middle of a movie or tv program I'm watching on line, I simply shut the lid, and hours later when I open it back up, it's right where I left it. My old Toshiba laptop crashed when it ran out of juice while I was using it, so Windows couldn't shut down properly!  I'll be perfectly happy if I never have to deal with Windows again. I don't need 10,11, or 12 tabs open like some apparently do. The screen is better than the one on my TV, and the sound is also far better than my old laptop. I agree that it can be somewhat sluggish, but for 95 per cent of the time, I have no problem. Definitely worth the money

Reviews.Title: Good bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: The laptop is good but not perfect the trackpad could be improved, the resolution is limited, it could 'built' better, hi-def videos sometimes startle. However, the tactile response of the keyboard is nice, the size is great for travel, the laptop is very light in weight, and the chromebook updates frequently. In fact I would say that I have seen the performance dramatically improve via updates.However, for a cost effective laptop that you can hand over to guests, I think this laptop proves to be a worthy purchase.

Reviews.Title: Fast!
Reviews.Author: JOAKIM THOREN
Reviews.Content: It is the fastest computer I've ever owned - atleast for starting up an browsing. Perfect for working with Google apps. Over all a great value.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the right expectation
Reviews.Author: Jason K.
Reviews.Content: This is my second Chromebook having passed down my Samsung 11.6" model from last year to my daughter. I have been a Mac user since 2002 personally and Windows professionally. I did not need to buy another MacBook and I have tried Windows 8 on 3 different budget laptops. The Chromebook I had last year seemed to work best for me when I wanted something other than an iPad to read and respond to email, catch up on social media, casual web surfing, and light writing in Google Docs.When I saw this new Chrombook 11 announced I thought it would be a great upgrade from the Samsung and it is, and it isn't.The design with the Google influence is great. I like the white plastic and rounded edges, much like the white MacBook I had years ago. The keyboard is great. Travel is perfect and it feels solid. The screen is amazing for a device in this price range. It is not a retina display but the blacks are rich, whites are bright, and I can read text easily - which is the most important thing really. Battery life so far seems fine for my needs and the micro USB charger is the perfect size to toss in a bag, I really hate the design of most laptop chargers, just too big to lug around. The track-pad works fine for me, some have said it is not great and it will never be as responsive as the glass on on a new MacBook Air but this is also over $700 cheaper. I am actually using an extra Apple Magic Mouse via Bluetooth and it works fine so far. The speakers are under the keyboard and are some of the best I have ever heard on a device of this size. You will not wake the neighbors but they don't distort and listening to music as I type this is actually a nice experience.The performance is average. I wish Google/HP would have bumped up the processor and memory. The 16GB of storage is fine since you store everything in the cloud anyway but you do see some lag watching videos full screen and web pages sometimes take a little longer to load than expected. I am also surprised the omitted an i/o for an SD card. There are decent, basic photo editors available and you can upload to Google Drive, Google+ or other sites. It's not a deal breaker but since the Samsung had it at a lower price point it should be here as well. Many have complained about USB 2.0 but I never took advantage of the 3.0 on the Samsung so again, not a deal breaker to me.All in all, this is a great buy. Its light, easy to type on, has a great screen, and will work well for my needs. That is the key thing to think about when buying a Chromebook, how it will work for you. If you already are comfortable with Google services and do not need traditional programs like MS Office and Photoshop you should be fine. I have actually started talking family members into Chromebooks when replacing old laptops because they only use them for web and email.HP is releasing another model this month with a 14" screen which will start at $299 and include a better processor but the screen on the Chromebook 11 makes it the one for me.

Reviews.Title: Excellent bang for your buck!!
Reviews.Author: dtg755
Reviews.Content: I have been toying with the idea of purchasing a Chromebook since Google first announced them, but I owned a laptop and thought it seems redundant to have both. As time has gone on, my ageing laptop as become more and more inconvenient and finally I decided something needed to change. I was hesitant about purchasing this particular Chromebook for fear that it would bog down easily or poorly handle multitasking. Thankfully, this is not the case at all. I am loving this device!! First and foremost, the build quality is incredible for this price point. There are no creaks or loose fitting items and it overall feels very Apple-esque in quality of build and material. Along those lines, the screen is amazing! I have played with last year's Samsung model and the screen on it looked like something you would get on a $250 computer. The screen on this Chromebook is incredible. The colors are rich, viewing angles are huge, and overall it is one of the best displays I've owned. Moving along, the keyboard is nearly perfect. I love chic-let keys, and this keyboard is the best I've used. The track pad isn't perfect, but it's a lot better than the one on my 4 year old Sony Vaio laptop. The speakers, which are hidden beneath the keyboard, are very good. They get extremely loud and stay clear throughout their volume range. Not much bass, but I wasn't expecting that. Battery life is decent, and I've had no problems leaving it unplugged for one or two days with use here and there before needing to charge it. Overall, I'm very happy I bought this and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a very user friendly, web based computer. Excellent job HP and Google!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Christian C.
Reviews.Content: I thought that I would give the Chromebook a try, and see how it goes. I absolutely love it. It does a lot of stuff that Mac's and PC's do.....For music you can use Spotify and for documents you can use Google. Great Build quality with a great display. Fantastic keyboard. The track pad is ok. I would defiantly recommend this to someone.

Reviews.Title: Perfect laptop
Reviews.Author: Bin L.
Reviews.Content: Very light-weighted, nice design and finish, responsive touchpad. Battery can last approx. 5 hours. Suitable for writing documents and programming when commuting.

Reviews.Title: Bad product. All bugged
Reviews.Author: Angelica Wohlenberg
Reviews.Content: The chromebook has two serious problems: the screen is blinking all the time and the charger stops to work frequently.I did powercash, reinstalled with USB and nothing fix the problem. And the worst: I cant return the item because I live in another country and the time expired. I am very disappointed with google and HP for awful gadget. Dont spend your money with chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Love my Chromebook 11, Great Service from Google and HP
Reviews.Author: qwertyuiop
Reviews.Content: I love my Chromebook.  Purchased it in January and love the integration with Google apps.  Received great service after loosing my home to a fire and needed a replacement charger.  Such friendly representatives at Google and HP. Thank you Google and HP for making a great product and keeping your customers number 1!

Reviews.Title: From delight to complete hatred in under 60 days
Reviews.Author: Benjamin P. Knight
Reviews.Content: I went from loving this thing to hating it intensely in a very short time.  This review covers the hardware itself, not Chrome OS.  Chrome OS is great, and I think it's a wonderful OS for home use.  In short, if you want a Chromebook, you can find a better device than this one.The biggest issue I found was that when I opened the lid after 30+ minutes of no use, the machine would turn back on, but the display wouldn't.  For example, if I had been previously listening to music when I closed the lid, the music would come back on, but the display would be totally off, even after opening & closing multiple times, pressing the brightness keys, or tapping the power button quickly.  Each time I would have to force shutdown the device and then power it back on, which was always a very slow startup.Another major issue was with the power charger.  This device uses a micro USB charger, which at first seems great because hey I have tons of Micro USB cords!  Maybe I could even charge my Chromebook in my car! Right? Wrong.  Unfortunately only the Chromebook's charger will work as normal micro USB chargers (e.g. for phones) are too "low power", as the message that pops up says when I plug it in.  Also, the physical connection itself is flimsy and janky.  Inexplicably, sometimes when I connected the charger the machine simply wouldn't charge... at all, with the indicator light remaining off.About me: I'm a software developer and I've been using computers since I was 10 years old.

Reviews.Title: Worked really well for 3 weeks.
Reviews.Author: skiqueen
Reviews.Content: I bought this Chromebook for work which requires use of web-based records. It worked incredibly well for about three weeks both at work and at home. One day, the screen started to flicker black, about once per minute. I thought I had a bad wi-fi connection. The next day it got worse...and worse...and worse. It got to the point that the screen was flickering so much I couldn't use the computer; a rate of every 1-2 seconds, regardless of which Wi-Fi I was using. I tried restarting. I switched operating systems. I disabled my extensions. I did a Powerwash. I did everything I could find to fix the situation, which apparently is a "software" issue. When nothing worked, I wanted to return it, but I missed my 30 day window to return it and now I'm stuck with it.I reported my issue to Google, but I don't think they answer when you report a problem. It is extremely frustrating that I cannot find anyone to speak to in regards to this issue, nor can I return to computer. The threads I've read state that this was an issue that was fixed with an OS update last November, but it's not working for me.On a positive note, when this computer did work, it was great. Beautiful screen, fast processing and everything I needed for work. If I didn't have this flickering screen issue with no apparent way to solve it I would give this 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a portable little computer!
Reviews.Author: southernbelle
Reviews.Content: I purchased the HP Chromebook 11 for my daughter to take to academic camps this summer, college-level courses. She has used it for about a week, and she loves it. I was worried that the RAM would be insufficient for her use, but other than when she has multiple high-memory webpages (tons of flash, etc.) opened simultaneously, it has functioned quite well. It is great for streaming Netflix and other video content, doesn't buffer at all. And although I prefer a larger screen, this one IS gorgeous. They keyboard and touchpad are better than the ones on my expensive laptop! The battery life is also a good 5 or 6 hours, which is 4 times better than mine. Really, I don't know why you'd buy anything more expensive whether you are looking for a backup laptop for travel (super-lightweight!) or something for lighter computing.

Reviews.Title: Great little laptop with the Chrome OS for offline usage.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: People have been telling me that you can’t use a Chromebook offline.  Well, you can if you get the Chromebook with the Chrome OS and HP is the only making it right now.  This little laptop is fast, light, durable aesthetically pleasing to look at.  My only issue with it is that there is no ‘End’, ‘Home’ or ‘Del’ keys.  The keyboard layout has been change to remove these three needed and very useful keys.  I have to be careful that then I go to hit ‘Del’ that I stop because that is where the power button is located.  In future version HP please put these keys back into place.  I like the automatically updating and ‘asking’ me to apply the updates now or when I shut down.  When I compare it to my WIN7 laptop this one runs rings around it.  My WIN7 laptop has no applications installed on it and basically a dumb frontend to the web.  Yet, its slow as can be with an i7 processor.  I can see Google overtaking Microsoft as long as they avoid an antitrust lawsuit.

Reviews.Title: Love it so far
Reviews.Author: Linda O'Connell "Linda O"
Reviews.Content: I haven't used the Chromebook a lot but so far I'm very happy with it.  I was looking for an inexpensive, light weight laptop and this fit the bill!  The response time is good on it too - at least so far.  I did have a problem with the first one I received - it suddenly refused to charge the battery.  But Amazon took care of it by immediately sending me a new one.  Amazon customer service, in my experience, is always excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: ChangChangChang
Reviews.Content: Bought it to replace my laptop, light weight and good enough for school work! recommended for people who are on the budget

Reviews.Title: Purchased two HP Chromebooks for our household
Reviews.Author: Mary Mahaydik "Boardwalk Angel"
Reviews.Content: We purchased two..one white/blue the other white/red.  Really like the ease of use but on one, the camera does not work at all.  For our needs, this can easily be worked around instead of going thru the hassle of returning and obtaining another unit.  However, when I went to the website after originally noticing the camera problem, I found a support board post hinting that camera issues may be considered 'common' for these units.  Wasn't very happy to see that at all and hope that the units hold up otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Less than $300 its everything and more
Reviews.Author: jhelms54
Reviews.Content: The Chromebook 11 is a different direction from traditional laptops and tablets.  Having everything you need with a small amount of power wrapped in a very nice package.  Now its not blisteringly fast but it moves quickly, it looks fantastic, it charges with micro-USB, why didn't I think of that...Overall I purchased this to see if I could use ChromeOS instead of an iPad or a laptop and the test was successful, I couldn't find anything I was missing from extremely expensive alternatives.

Reviews.Title: Good with a flaw
Reviews.Author: Isabel
Reviews.Content: This is a great computer, it works really well. The only thing stopping me from giving it 5 stars is the charger. I had to order a new one, but it came free from the company. The computer nonetheless works amazingly. I'm a high school student and this has helped me out a lot, so much my school is getting similar computers for all the students next year.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for my requirements
Reviews.Author: John C. D'Amico
Reviews.Content: HP Chromebook 11 was a pleasant surprise in the ease of setting up, speed and performance. Great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: Does Exactly What It's Advertised To Do!
Reviews.Author: daddyofthree
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a full-function laptop, don't buy a Chromebook!  If you want a very well-designed, lightweight, fast, easy-to-use notebook and usually have a wireless internet connection available, then a Chromebook is perfect for you.I've only spent a few days with the HP 11, but I'm very impressed so far.  Screen is great - very clear, and rivals that of a much more expensive machine.  I will also say that the design of this Chromebook is right up there with a certain (fruity) competitor - about time the rest of the computer world shows they know how to make a good looking machine as well.  Touch pad with multi-gestures is great - I'm sure I'll be missing these features when I have to use my work laptop (PC).  So easy to scroll, right-click, flip between tabs, etc.  all with different combinations of finger swipes.If you're interested in a Chromebook, make sure you read up on Google's website about them - they ARE limited in what they can do.  I bought this primarily for web browsing and e-mail around the house and in hotels, and the HP Chromebook 11 will certainly live up to that.PROS:Great designLightweightQuiet - have not heard a single 'computer noise' come from this thing! - not sure if it makes any noise at all!Fast - boots up in seconds as advertisedCONS:No back-light for keyboard - can be difficult when typing in the darkLimited off-line use - again, this machine is designed to use with an active internet connection!

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love!!
Reviews.Author: Hisako Laschober
Reviews.Content: Love it !! Easy to use and portable, which I was looking for!!I am traveling with this computer next month, so I will see.

Reviews.Title: Great Chormebook
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: This was a great deal. I love the Chromebooks. Working with computers for over 3 decades, this is the best.Fast startup. super design. Don't listen to all the junk about being tied to the internet. This machine will work with you for all our computing needs. Writing papers, spreadsheets, watching videos. Works flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: Great value, good looking computer
Reviews.Author: MB
Reviews.Content: This is my second Chromebook. I paid $25 more than what I paid for the first, a Samsung model. The front bezel broke on my Samsung, and the construction of this HP seems to be slightly better. However, the Samsung had better battery life. This one seems to last about 4 hours, but the Samsung was more like 5 or 6. Otherwise, it's a great machine.

Reviews.Title: HP Chromebook 11 (white/blue)
Reviews.Author: tessy
Reviews.Content: The brightness is excellent, much better than the dull/flat/muted colors of the Samsung chrome, which I was ecstatically happy to have, and used daily. This HP Chromebook merely offers, (for a hike in the price, Samsung can be gotten for $229. and I paid $275 for the HP), a brightness that is more like an Apple laptop, which has all the bells and whistles. The purpose for which I purchased this, was to upgrade on the picture/color, while passing on my baby: Samsung Chromebook onto one who was without anything, prior had been homeless, and now has a room with only a window, no TV privileges or state of the art toys to play with. There is cable in the house, so I decided to give her my Samsung. I personally would not have considered buying another 'upgraded' Chromebook, but her need prompted me.  I am pleased with my choice, and can't wait to give her (she's my 63 yr old cousin in another state..Maine) the Samsung, which I'd been so pleased to use. I now couldn't do without a computer of sorts, as one receives so much info from it. The ONLY thing I preferred on the Samsung, was the connecting cord. An EXCELLENT feature. There's was simply a small hole, which I stuck the cord in with ease, and it spun naturally no matter which way I laid on the couch, or which direction I moved. I didn't need to take care, that it might break. That was a great feature. This one (my only disappointment) has a connection cord more like a phone connecting cord...it's difficult to put in, and can break if not absolutely flat. The color on my new HP makes me so happy, especially when I am watching a movie. That's the only reason why this one is better. As far as aesthetics, I don't care to much about that. It would have been nice if they made a glowing keyword for the night so I could see what I was typing/texting in the dark. Other than the picture, which is so much more colorful, and does please me greatly, there is no other feature to warrant the upgraded price. I'm a bit disappointed, for a difference of approximately  $50.00 more, that more features couldn't have been offered for the extra money. The outside of the computer doesn't much matter to me. It's nice, (white and blue) but I was also happy with the silver. I hope this helps, it's all about the color of the screen. If you will use it for films, it's a nice thing to have, for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great for its intended purpose
Reviews.Author: consumer101
Reviews.Content: I bought the chromebook for its small size and portability. I was stuck between this and the toshiba chromebook and I definitely made the right choice. One of the main selling points for me was the charger, which is compatible with my phone. However, the charger is  delicate and mine was broken when it arrived. Fortunately, customer service was excellent and I got a new charger very quickly. It's not a perfect product, but I am definitely pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: stuart zelmanovitz
Reviews.Content: Chrome operates beautifully. It browses, streams and allows me to work on docs with great ease. The battery lasts a decent amount of time, it doesn't really crash and it is light as a feather. Limited; but a great machine.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Computer!
Reviews.Author: camofreak92
Reviews.Content: This is by far my favorite laptop that I've owned yet! It's small and light, yet works amazingly! Highly Recommend!

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Riduwan
Reviews.Content: It's slim and light and really easy to use but performance is mainly based on the need for stable wifi connection.

Reviews.Title: Excellent build quality - useful device
Reviews.Author: P. Firth
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a light, portable surfing tool with a good screen. I looked at the Samsung 11.6 inch unit, but it seemed flimsy and the screen was not clear. I'm very happy with the HP. The keyboard is about as good as a chicklet style gets... quite easy to type on. I would have liked a lighted keyboard, but so far that doesn't happen at this price. Something happened to my charger soon after I got it, though I don't think I had the overheating problem. The original charger was rated at 3 amps. Believe me, it's nearly impossible to find another one that will provide 3A on one line. All of the supposed 3A charges I could find source 1A on one port and 2.1 amps on a second USB port, for charging an iPad and a phone, for example. My iPad 4 charger provides only 2A. This device BARELY charges on 1-2 amps when powered down, and not at all if on (even when closed). So you really need the 3A charger, which they are replacing free (finally after 2+ months).I was very happy to get 12 free GoGo sessions. That was enough to nearly pay the cost of the unit, for me. I have already used 2 of those sessions. Not sure if it would have made sense, otherwise. The processor is probably slower than the new Windows 8 tablets with Bay Trail processors. Not sure if you'll get smooth video on this one. It's not available on flights, and there is not enough RAM in this unit 16 GB to keep movies. And no services let you put them onto jump drives. So it doesn't look like it will fill that need, and I have to watch movies on my Galaxy Tab 3 8-inch, which is a great solution. But when can I carry ONE device with me instead of 2 or more? Still waiting. Windows 8 does not have the apps I use on Android, and probably never will. I hate the weight and other issues with my iPad, such as lack of memory expansion. Perhaps the newer, dual-boot Android-Win8 devices will fill the void.

Reviews.Title: awesome laptop!!!
Reviews.Author: steven02x
Reviews.Content: great lap top for your everyday things. browsing the web, youtube, listening to music, watching movies, email, social media, writing a report for school etc...its all here, there is no need to spend 500 to 1500 bucks on a laptop unless you are doing some hardcore graphics design, video editing, pro tools etc. everything you need is built in and runs smooth. computer is fast enough for what its made for. also, with the newest update there is a lot of off line apps now for the people that are worried about it only working while its connected to the internet. works fine off line from my experience. last but not least is the design. the thing looks awesome, its very attractive. it feels very sturdy and very comfortable to work on. keyboard and track pad are great and the sound that comes out of the key board sounds really good. the display is amazing for how little the device costs. its sharp, great color accuracy and very bright. overall a great laptop for everyday stuff. you wont regret buying it

Reviews.Title: Just Get One!
Reviews.Author: Peacefrog
Reviews.Content: The search for a notebook/ultrabook/laptop limits your choices to essentially Macs and Win machines.  If you are weary of Win updates, its clunky UI, malware/antivirus subscriptions, slow start-ups, etc., just get one of these.After a day learning how to navigate the Google drive and its file system, this Chromebook is a cinch to use.  You will be pleased with its smooth performance, bright IPS screen, very decent keyboard and trackpad.Having used a myriad of Windows machines and a handful of Macs over the years, this little guy is a pleasure to use. Seriously, if you are not into extensive video/photo processing or a power user, this HP Chromebook is hard to beat and you just might find it does just about anything for which you need a computer.I just sold a three year old Win 7 machine and gave away a Win 8 laptop.  For me, the move to a Chromebook was a good decision. Quite pleased and this one comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Dont Buy This!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: brianna
Reviews.Content: not happy at all this HP chomebook. I bought it on 03/24/2012)and used it for everyday use (Web browsing, email, ect) worked fine for a while. but quit working a few weeks back. will not charge or turn on, the charger works fine with my phones so Im sure its the chomebook.I contacted HP a week ago and still have not heard back...if you are thinking about buying this... Do yourself the favor and keep saving your $$ and buy something better.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my personal use and am very satisfied with it. Though the processor dose not have much power, due to its design, HP Chromebook 11 much better than comparable products form others.

Reviews.Title: READ BELOW
Reviews.Author: James N Tresler Jr
Reviews.Content: BEST SCREEN OF ANY CHROMEBOOK, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE $1,000+ CHROMEBOOK PIXEL.  LIGHTEST WEIGHT CHROMEBOOK.  BEST LOOKING (IN MY OPINION) CHROMEBOOK, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF THE CHROMEBOOK PIXEL.  GREAT SOUNDING SPEAKERS.  IF YOU CAN LIVE WITH THE MEDIOCRE EXYNOS ARM PROCESSOR AND THE  MEDIOCRE BATTERY LIFE...THIS IS THE RIGHT CHROMEBOOK FOR YOU.

Reviews.Title: Great Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Does everything I really need it to for casual use around the house. Light, portable, and very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Intuitive and Wallet Friendly
Reviews.Author: Horanano
Reviews.Content: This is a nice change of pace compared to the Windows vs. Mac war that has evolved those computers into more and more cluttered screen space. With the Chromebook I get a clean interface, quick power on and off, simplistic settings, plus a great screen, a comfortable keyboard, surprisingly powerful speakers, and a sleek and complete computer unit (no screws, fan slots, etc.). I use this computer currently for school, but it has become my primary computer at home too other than the occasional use of itunes away from my iphone. YouTube and other websites run smoothly with only slight delay with clicks, and Drive gives all the essentials for Word, Excel or similar types of documents (although don't expect scrolling to be quite as smooth as webpages, because it isn't). Overall, this computer is well worth the cost, and it is much more than I expected from a $279 laptop. Keep that in mind (it's not a $2000 gaming desktop), and you'll see what this Chromebook has to offer.

Reviews.Title: really pretty
Reviews.Author: Chey
Reviews.Content: Just got it and so far nothing bad at all from me! I cant wait to use this more! Itll be amazing if everything works out

Reviews.Title: amazing!
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I just got this today and i was amazed at how small and light this was. This is the first chrome book i ever got and so far i am very impressed by this, the design and the color scheme fits perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Great, but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Hexydes
Reviews.Content: I've been using the HP Chromebook 11 for about two weeks now. In general, I'm very happy with it, but it's definitely still a compromise.Pros:- Relatively cheap.- Fantastic form-factor.- Very nice screen.Cons:- Battery is only average.- Speed is only average, much slower than Haswell-based Chromebooks.Overall, it's a nice computer, but I really feel HP should have stuck a Haswell-based processor in here, as well as 4GB of memory, and charged another $20-30 for it (around $300). That would have made this a very special computer; as it is, it's just a nice option in Chromebook land. One additional note: I've been having screen flickering problems the last few days, so I'm hoping there isn't some manufacturer's defect...

Reviews.Title: 1 star until I get my replacement charger
Reviews.Author: Silence Dogood "JOrD"
Reviews.Content: I just want to point out that my original charge gets extremely hot and does not act normal when charging. 33 days ago I contacted Google because they didn't have the U.S location where the replacement would be sent, I asked them why the option of sending it was not available, still waiting on that answer. I'm stuck using a tablet charger :(((The last communication from them was 12 days ago:I apologize for the delay in response, I have escalated your case. When I receive any information I will let you know.Thank you for your patience in this matter.Best,****The Chrome Ninja Team))They won't send me the charger, but I bought a Nexus 4 from the Google play store and was sent to my location with no problem.

Reviews.Title: After 2 months, it's a paperweight.
Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: The charger was recalled for overheating.  Problem is the replacement overheated too.  Then it quit working.  I get a notice saying I am using a low power charger and the chromebook may not charge.  It doesn't.  I'm hoping that 24 hours or so will get me enough power to get all my personal stuff off the thing altogether.  I let them know what was going on.  They don't care.  One of the things I liked about this thing in the first place was that it used the same charger as phones etc. but that is not true.  The unit itself was not supposed to get hot but it does.  I would have returned it within 2 weeks but kept it after being promised a good charger.  HP lied to me.  Plain and simple.  Nothing wrong with the chargers - the unit itself is the problem.

Reviews.Title: worked only for a month
Reviews.Author: tonino
Reviews.Content: then a battery recall....(still waiting for replacement)then unable to charge....then unable to open......then backordered...so no return possible.Still sitting with a dead product at my house.

Reviews.Title: Died fairly quickly
Reviews.Author: Daniel Florencio
Reviews.Content: Had it for a grand total of three months.It just sort of died, won't turn back on no matter how much I charge it. Also, the charger gets really really hot.

Reviews.Title: need to return ASAP
Reviews.Author: andrew c.
Reviews.Content: not charging properly and power is not working either.  no manuals to trouble shoot and the charger malfunctioning and had to order another.

Reviews.Title: Jan 14/2014, still no working power adapter.
Reviews.Author: Bob34787
Reviews.Content: I purchased this chromebook just before Google pulled them from the shelves because of exploding power adapters.  I'm still waiting for a replacement. Google and HP have been less than honest with their recommendation to use any micro USB power adapter as a substitute until a proper replacement arrives. Standard high power 2 amp USB chargers will only charge the Chromebook when its turned off. The Chromebook uses a non-standard 3 am USB charger. When the Chromebook is in use with a 2amp charger, the battery is discharging, limiting the amount of time daily you can use the Chromebook before you have to shut it off and charge it.  Funny, Google didn't mention that.  Good luck finding a 3rd party USB charger than can support 3 amps on one USB port.1 star for crappy quality, poor followup, and being less than forthcoming with the truth.

Reviews.Title: Poor charger port
Reviews.Author: A Victory
Reviews.Content: This computer has the same problem that the Amazon Kindle has; it uses a mini USB port for charging.  This port can not hold up for long.  i have had three Kindles and also this HP Chromebook and all have failed exclusively due to this port becoming loose and failing to make a good connection.  Eventually it becomes impossible to charge the device.  Very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Hardware alright, software needs improvement
Reviews.Author: Reza Housseini
Reviews.Content: The build quality is what you would except, the only problem lies with the ChromeOS which still needs some improvements before counting as a real OS.

Reviews.Title: Wrong color
Reviews.Author: Boyd Bernard
Reviews.Content: I had ordered a green book and got a blue one . The box was marked green but inside it was blue.

Reviews.Title: As a gift for my 10 year old
Reviews.Author: Edwin Soto
Reviews.Content: This is my son's first computer and I have to say that it has far exceeded my expectations. It has a really small form factor, but if you're looking for portability, you've come to the right place. It's light, comes in some neat colors (I purchased the blue one) and feels very sleek to the touch.As far as the OS goes, Chrome OS is very nicely tied to your Google accounts and there are so many applications in the store right now that that it works really well with transitioning from other software.

Reviews.Title: HP  chromebook received and tested throughly,it's great
Reviews.Author: Marlene Severinsen
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with my new chromebook it was everything I expected and more.It's easy to use and has great battery life

Reviews.Title: For the price, size and my requirements, it has been a terrific buy.
Reviews.Author: Alex McFerran
Reviews.Content: For the price, size and my requirements, it is a terrific buy. Wish instructions for converting excel & word files from old computer were easier to follow.

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUY
Reviews.Author: STACE
Reviews.Content: Greattttttttt purchase. It fits in my purse n does everything a computer does. U will not be dissatisfied! HAPPY yyy I got it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing absolutely love it!!
Reviews.Author: CheChe
Reviews.Content: First I'll say the price is amazing such a great deal! Second I absolutely love this laptop I wasn't sure about it because of the great price and it's not the newest model but it came in perfect condition and it's perfect for me! It even had a camera which I did not know! It's good for entertainment and social media purposes Facebook,Netflix,movies,web etc it's not really I working computer so anything intricate this laptop isn't for you! Otherwise it's great! Loveee it

Reviews.Title: Grad Student's First Thoughts
Reviews.Author: Ruhee
Reviews.Content: I just picked up my HP Chromebook 11 from the local Best Buy (didn't want to wait to have it delivered). After spending about 30 minutes with it so far, I think I might be in love. I have a 15" Macbook Pro that was just too big and heavy for me to lug all the way to campus while using public transportation. This Chromebook fits perfectly into my oversized purse, and I can see myself using it in class and on the train to get work done. I'll be editing my review once I've spent a few days with the device.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: R. Ortiz
Reviews.Content: This chromebook is just beautiful. If you want an alternative to a laptop which you can use to connect remotely to other machines, this is the way to go. Even if you just need a box to browse the 'net and do some basic stuff, this will be the right choice. Portability and reliability (forget about antivirus software or problems with OS updates as in Windows), just go ahead and buy yourself one, you will not regret it. The keyboard is amazingly comfortable, the display is very good and the track pad is very responsive.

Reviews.Title: Great device but VPN is flaky
Reviews.Author: Steven P Tuscher
Reviews.Content: The chromebook is a fabulous device.  I only gave it four stars because the VPN does not work well.  Everything else works great. Fast and light. If VPN is not a requirement for you then you should have no problems.

Reviews.Title: A wonderful gift
Reviews.Author: Raptor
Reviews.Content: Wow this is fast and practical. Got this as a gift on valentines day.... and just opened it today. So far it is a 5 star rating. Loving everything about it. The fast boot-up and the look and feel of the chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Happy with my purchase
Reviews.Author: Frank E. Shoemaker Jr.
Reviews.Content: I ordered my HP Chromebook 11 for my wife directly from Google when they were first released. I had to return it within a day after the USB charging port wouldn't accept power or a charge. Second unit arrived about a week later and it's worked like a charm. Received the replacement charger from Google along with a $25 Play gift certificate. Customer service was pleasant.I'm a fan of the Chrome OS concept. Lots of cloud based apps that require Wi-Fi and just enough offline apps to meet most of our needs. I haven't had any Wi-Fi issues with this unit as others have reported. Lots of issues can affect Wi-Fi like the Wi-Fi antennae on router, router channels, interference and the Wi-Fi antennae on the Chromebook. I would challenge those users that have had issues with Wi-Fi to use a Wi-Fi analyzer on their network to determine the best channels to use on their router before blaming the Chromebook.Just a quick blurb about cost others may not have mentioned. This unit cost me $300 delivered that included a complementary 100 gigs of Google Drive storage for 2 years ($120 savings). $180 Chromebook for 2 years? A great deal in my book.My likes:CostDesignWeightScreenChrome Remote Desktop App (allows me to connect remotely to my office Mac mini)Google Drive cloud storage (installed on my Mac mini as well)Chrome OS apps - Hangouts, Google Voice, Uberconference just to name a few of my favorites. I use Hangouts to speak to website owners and share my screen while I actively change sites to their desire.My dislikes:Chrome OS missing a couple key Google products I need for work. No Google Earth or Google Earth web plugin and no Sketchup.I would love to get the LTE version of the HP Chromebook 11 but not having Google Earth and Sketchup is a deal breaker for me.

Reviews.Title: I love my chrome computer
Reviews.Author: Jill R Griffin
Reviews.Content: I haven't had my computer long but I do enjoy having one at home.  This is my first new computer. Once I found internet service in my area I was up and running.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Beautifully Designed for Everyday Web-based usage
Reviews.Author: Boliang
Reviews.Content: I love this chrome book because it is (IMO) the best looking out there. HP has always been good in terms of designs of products. This chrome book is very well crafted and very pleasing to the eye!The display is, as everyone has been saying, absolutely stunning! I love the keyboard on this HP 11 too, even though it is not extremely ideal, but it's pretty good for a netbook.If you are looking for a Chromebook with extreme speed, the HP11 may not be your choice. The processor on board is a little too cheesy. Opening up a few webpages and it's starting to stretching its limit. However, it still handles most of the tasks well enough.Reviewing this from a student's perspective, I would love to say it is a very good gadget to bring to school everyday - light weight and does almost everything. I am super happy to swap my 15 inch Macbook Pro out of my backpack. A laptop built solely on a web browser might seem ridiculous at the beginning, but after a month with it, I'm actually amazed by how well it handles all my daily tasks. Of course, I don't do coding or photoshopping on my HP11, but it's ideal for web reading and essay writing. Google docs works pretty good on this product.Overall, the HP11 is a beautifully designed and carefully crafted piece of electronics. Definitely a great netbook!

Reviews.Title: Great Device
Reviews.Author: Kyle Mercier
Reviews.Content: So far, I have been using my Chromebook for about 3 hours, and it has been working great. I thought I would have an issue connecting to the WiFi at my school, but luckily I have not had an issue what-so-ever.To start off, the packaging that the Chromebook came in was actually pleasing. I loved the simplicity of it, because this is just that. A simple device that is what you make it.Since this was my first Chromebook, I had to do my research. I looked up many reviews, and finally decided to go with this one. The HP Chromebook 11 is a very sleek, small device that will easily fit in a backpack, or a purse if your a female. When I take this to class tomorrow, not only will I feel very studious, but I will be able to access all my notes and resources available right in front of me.The keyboard of the Chromebook is very responsive and the feels great when I am typing this review. I love the spacing between the keys since I have larger hands, it helps with hitting the correct keys.While there have been complaints about the trackpad, I haven't found the same issue with it. Those who have said that the trackpad was sticky must of had something on their fingers because there is nothing wrong with it for me.Overall, I am glad that I made this purchase, and will maybe get another one for my fiance.

Reviews.Title: Good !
Reviews.Author: Kunie TANINO
Reviews.Content: It is light. It is happy. The screen of it is beautiful. Garmin Plugin cannot be done though it is my investigation shortage. It was thought that it was able to be used by the destination. It was regrettable.

Reviews.Title: I'm happy and here is why.
Reviews.Author: Zachary R Abramson
Reviews.Content: I chose to buy a chromebook because I am very intrigued by the idea of cloud computing, not just cloud storage.  I have a macbook air and I decided to use only the chrome browser for one month.  I was able to do it easily, using google docs and other free web-apps.When looking at chromebooks, I was only considering the 11 inch ones.  I did not think I would ever prefer to grab a 14 inch 3lb chromebook over my 11 inch macbook air.  I compared the acer c720, hp 11, and samsung series 3.  Two factors made me choose the hp 11 chromebook.  1) The screen is amazing.  It is significantly better than the macbook air. The colors are rich and really pop.  I often have the chromebook hp 11 and my macbook side by side and you can really tell the difference.  2) micro USB charging.  I really like this as a concetp.  I have an Anker Astro E5 external battery that I carry in my bag to charge my phone.  I tried using it with the hp chromebook 11 and while it will not charge the hp 11 to 100 percent, it will keep it at its current charge for an extra 5 hours or so.  It is nice to take a small shoulder bag with my phone, chromebook, and an iPad if I want and never have to worry about finding a charger at Starbucks.Pros:Beautiful screenNice keyboardPretty good speakers from underneath the keyboardLight weight.Good looks.The cons:It's slow.  Web pages take a while to load.  Older processor and 2 gb of RAM is limiting.The track pad lags and your finger sticks to it.  It is not smooth like the pixel or the macbook air.The plastic casing creaks.In summary, as an intro to chrome OS, I am very happy.  I love technology and I enjoy learning of the new chrome OS features and getting to try them out each month. For $279, i'll take the slow computing speed, redeem my google drive space, use my free gogo in-flight internet passes, never have to worry about finding an outlet, and be very happy.

Reviews.Title: Love the Chromebook if I could easily charge it!
Reviews.Author: Judith M. Stewart
Reviews.Content: The chromebook is lightweight, easy to use with good screen resolution. My only issue is the original charger was deemed defective and replacement was sent. The replacement is very temperamental and it is difficult to charge the chromebook. Have to resort to a slow phone charger which can only charge up when the chromebook is turned off.Other than charging, I do really like using the chromebook

Reviews.Title: Dead after 2 weeks
Reviews.Author: Scott28411
Reviews.Content: Bought for our sons 14th birthday- but battery failed after 2 weeks.  Returning to HP/Google, hope for better replacement- but have seen on Google Support many stories of the same.Designed obsolescence sure is getting faster & faster (first every couple years, now every couple weeks...technology kinda becoming like a disposable razor!?!)

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Julia J
Reviews.Content: Not the best laptop, Like windows 8 better, but if you are looking for a light and cheap laptop for school this would be the one.

Reviews.Title: Compact and colors cute!!
Reviews.Author: Kensuke Takagi
Reviews.Content: Display of Chromebook HP 11 is beautiful. I was using the Samsung Chromebook of from before, but the display did not work. Color you are bluish, feeling that pixel is rough. There is no stress nothing.

Reviews.Title: power cord
Reviews.Author: Diane Latini
Reviews.Content: Still waiting for the replcement power cord since one sent with chromebook was recalled..  Otherwise, works well when i can charge it..

Reviews.Title: Disappointed but can only blame myself
Reviews.Author: Samir Darba
Reviews.Content: This is the first and only review I have ever posted on Amazon, but I felt the need to over this product.As many other reviewers suggest the best thing to do before purchasing is really understanding what you are buying.  I wasn't smart enough to do this when I bought the chromebook on impulse, and as a result a lot of my complaints could of been mitigated if I had done further research.I don't posses a strong hardware or consumer electronics knowledge, so I will not be making too many comparison to other products.What I like:The Chromebook 11 by most measures is aesthetically pleasing, light, and extremely portable.The speakers on this laptop are surprisingly loud and clear.The display is beautiful.  Fan boys of other products that cost 5-7x the cost make argue that the display isn't very good, but I believe they are comparing Apples to Filet Mingion.Since I already use a lot of Google products (gmail, calendar, google +, drive, etc), other web applications (Evernote, Workflowy, etc), and an Android Phone I found the chromebook to be extremely supportive of my work flow and is probably the overall reason why I use the Chromebook.Also the operating system turns on and off quickly which is a nice plus.Things That I Don't Like:If you are someone who has a lot of tabs open at once, you are going to hate yourself.  Since I am someone who generally has a lot of tabs open you can probably guess my frustration.  The problem is the more tabs you have open the slower each page loads.  I normally like to mass open 20-25 political articles and read for an hour or two, but Chromebook doesn't effectively allow me to do that.  Obviously there are simple ways to get around this, but it is still a slight nuisanceIf you plan on streaming something, don't plan on trying to do anything else.  If you are trying to watch Netflix or Hulu you can't do anything else.  It will cause the video to freeze.  I know watching Netflix/Hulu probably wasn't the intended user case for the machine, but as someone who likes to do both of those things, it is frustrating.  Similarly I have had connectivity issues with Amazon Prime's video service, which really annoys me too.Things I HATE about the Product:The BATTERY IS SO BAD.  The battery is awful and the charger is a big ole slap in the face.  This is the sole reason I wouldn't recommend this product.  I actually had the intention of buying 2 more of these Chromebooks for Mothers and Fathers day, but quickly realized I was better saving and just getting my parents ipads for their Birthdays.I genuinely hope the engineer that designed the charger was fired, because they were a moron to say the least.  The biggest problem with the charger is that the battery of the machine still drains while plugged in.  Meaning if you are working on something while you battery is low, you might try to plug your chromebook in and attempt to continue to work only to find yourself SOL.To effectively charge the chromebook it needs to be completely powered off.  Even then the charger doesn't charge very well.  For example last night before I slept my chromebook had 9% battery.  I powered it off and charged it and when I woke up 8 hours later it only had 77% battery (its like the charge is being generated via hamster wheel).  Similarly I used my chromebook unplugged for a hour after waking up and it dropped the battery down to 50%.  Even as I am writing this right now with my chromebook plugged in, I see the battery slowly dying on me.  I should note I currently have display brightness at lowest possible setting and the only application I have open is this one Google Chrome tab to write this review.Finally occasionally(probably a few times a day) you get the lovely 'low power charger connected' error which is really HP Chromebooks way of telling you 'hey don't count on me working for the next few hours'.  I have tried other micro usb chargers with no avail.Overall:Its a decent device and I still use everyday, but I would not buy it again.  In my humble opinion most people would not find this device useful. I would suggest that most people are probably better spent saving a little extra money and buying something better.  Frustration over the battery alone has probably raised my blood pressure, especially before I figured out that the battery was draining even while plugged in.As someone who is kind of a Google Fanboy, I am really disappointed to see that the company would associate itself which such a stupid battery/charger design.If this flaw was fixed I would easily rate this product higher and would feel more comfortable buying this as a gift for relatives and friends.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't Charge
Reviews.Author: FDR
Reviews.Content: Two weeks after owning this product, the charger has quit working.  It started as a short that occasionally charged, but will not charge at all now.

Reviews.Title: Chrome Newbie review
Reviews.Author: E. Hipolito "Occasional Book worm"
Reviews.Content: Initial Impressions:Build.This is my first Chromebook. The build itself is very stylish. Kinda surprising when the case is really made of plastic. I like that they put some kind of padding at the bottom and the color goes with the border thingie on the keyboard. It looks really clean and subdued. The keyboard has a nice feel to them. Reminds me of Macbook air.PerformanceIt's like automatic when I push the power button. I can close it and just pick up where I left off a few hours later. I noticed that it gets warm if I put it on a pillow. But its ok when you just carry it around or on your lap. I tend to open a lot of tabs and I noticed that battery life can take a hit if you do this. To be fair I had over a dozen tabs open most of the time and not having so much can improve battery life. The playback of videos from my Movies and TV library can be a little annoying though. When I'm watching and I accidentally touch the trackpad, just touch not click, the video seems to skip a little. So for the most part if I'm watching I leave it alone.The camera is horrible though, it looks like I'm always in a dark room even though I have ample lighting in the room. So when I chat with my mom who lives in Sydney, I use my tablet.AppsI'm trying to get used to how the apps work. For example, if I watch the movies of tv shows on my google TV or tablet, I have to use the play movies app. But here I have to remember to watch them via Youtube. I just hope they standardize it among google products. Not a big deal but a source of confusion for newbies.I hope google can entice more developers to develop more quality games. Most of the games are casual in nature so for the most part I go back to my Windows 7 pc to play (I like to consider myself a serios PC gamer).Summary:So far I'm happy with my purchase. Will update soon after a few more weeks.Update 10/20/2013The keyboard is not backlit so normally I just use the light from the screen to help me see the letters on the keyboard. Kinda primitive lol.The sound from the speaker is not bad at all. I must have lowered my expectations from some of the other reviews but its ok. However I noticed that if I use it as my "radio" it does take a decent drain battery wise. So use earphones when you can.I also found out that my old phone charger is of low power charger for the chromebook. So I now use the chromebook charger as my charger for tablet and phone as well.Also when you lie in bed and you use the chrmebook, the screen doesn't swivel as much as ordinary laptops. So you'll need a pillow to prop up your head (I normally rest it against my lap but I usually have my legs folded up so I open the chromebook as much as I can and use  pillow). It's not a big deal but it's one of those things you notice.I have to say that the no hard angles approach work for me. It's just good to look at.All in all its just minor things that I was used to with my old laptop.

Reviews.Title: Best little laptop on the market
Reviews.Author: Fitnessdad.com
Reviews.Content: I use this chromebook more than my Microsoft laptop.  It is quiet in fact just got done shutting down the old laptop as it was locking up anyway.  Check out my full review at Phone and Beyond website.

Reviews.Title: Stupid enough to try again?
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I used this computer for five hours, plugged it in for the night, woke up the next morning to use it again, and it would not even turn on.Which is too bad because, for the five hours that I DID use it, I loved it. I don't need a flashy piece of hardware mucked down with a million programs running a million processes. I just wanted something simple to write on. A small, notebook-sized laptop that was portable and sleek and functional.I got all of the above with the exception of "functional" which, it turns out, is pretty vital.I'm returning the dead one and buying another one. The reviews have been largely good and I have faith that this little machine is what I'm looking for. Maybe I just got one of the few duds that comes off the line every once in a blue moon...But I'll tell you one thing. I'm going to worry every morning I get up and open the lid that I'll be met by the same blank, light-less screen I woke up to this morning. Is it worth the worry, or am I just being goggle-eyed for google hardware that isn't out of its infancy yet?

Reviews.Title: It is nice
Reviews.Author: patricia bryan
Reviews.Content: I love white laptops but I am not used to the chrome products, so I sent it back when I became frustrated with the difference in chrome compared to microsoft, which is used a lot at the colleges and needs to be compatible. I just dont have the money to buy compatibility software...and i dont like the fact that all of my business is up in cyber space somewhere and not stored on the laptop . I am a visual person and like to get to my stuff right away in my view. But otherwise it's a great, compact, light and easy to use product.

Reviews.Title: Awful!! Do not buy if you want to avoid headaches.
Reviews.Author: Admir Monteiro
Reviews.Content: When I first purchase my Chromebook HP 11 I rushed to give Google great reviews because I thought it is a Google product, and there is no chance Google will screw up a laptop. But I can honestly tell you that the only good thing about this laptop is the fact that was produced by HP because I had nothing but issues with Chromebook HP 11. Allow to name it for you fine folks out there:1- You can't download anything to this crappy laptop.2- Forget about playing DVD or use your iTunes or anything that is not supported by Google.3- Also prepare yourself to have all kinds of issues trying to use your printer, and I printer better from my iPhone.4- Google docs are a waste of time and if you are thinking stop working with Microsoft Office then I wish you good luck.5- I was thinking that I might be able to use at work and again another disappointment because my work wireless encryption is not supported by the Chromebook but it is supported by Apple, Microsoft and everybody else except Google.6- Hell! If 5 reasons are not enough for you to make the wise decision then I wish you good luck.

Reviews.Title: Good 2nd laptop
Reviews.Author: M. Dembski
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a second laptop and for the most part I am happy.  Do not get it expecting anything close to a regular laptop in terms of functionality.  I would be been willing to pay a bit more for a device that is faster.  I would probably get it again but just keep your expectations limited.1.  Keyboard is real good for a low cost device2.  Sound competes with much more expensive devices3.  Speed is the weakest part of the laptop.  It is barely as fast as an atom based device.4.  Functionality is limited

Reviews.Title: Not what I thought
Reviews.Author: Lesley Crutchfield
Reviews.Content: I bought the Chromebook last year to use for my home business and for schoolwork. It is impossible for me to do anything on this computer because the Wi-Fi always drops off and you have to keep disconnecting, reconnecting, refreshing, etc. I purchased an adapter so that I can hook my internet (Comcast) up and use it that way---EVEN SLOWER or not at all... I am so disappointed because it has great features--when you can access them. I like a computer that already has an antivirus program built in. But this is not good--Google, Samsung (they have one) and HP need to get back to the drawing board on this one...Sorry..

Reviews.Title: Needs more RAM and a stronger processor
Reviews.Author: M. Fiori "A Concerned Parent"
Reviews.Content: I guess these devices are targeted at people who otherwise would or have been using the lowest powered devices you can get these days or older devices. If you use Amazon, you know what the real cost of RAM is. 2Gb just doesn't cut it. With 4 or even 8gb, these things would be excellent.It's kind of unfortunate that everyone continues to ride the coat tails of AAPL and make exorbitant amounts of money selling 'upgraded' devices with incremental amounts of RAM for what amounts to stupid amounts of money.Having said that, if you spend most of your time 'on the internet', using Google, this is going to do what you need to do for a reasonable amount of money. If you want something that you can take outside of your house and not be concerned about losing or having stolen that will get you through a day on a charge. This is something that can work for you.

Reviews.Title: So many issues
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth grant
Reviews.Content: This device is small, light, and compact, which makes it perfect for travel. I just stick it in my backpack with my books and other items and it barely makes a difference, which is great.  However, I have a lot of issues with it when it comes to use.  The biggest problem I have is charging.  I bought the device in October and Google replaced the charger for me sometime in November/December and at first things were going seemingly okay.  Recently, though, I've had issues where the device isn't charging all the time, I have to hold the charger a certain way so that it does charge, or it says the charger is a low power charger and won't charge while the device is on.  This is such a hassle and extremely inconvenient.Other issues I have with this device, such as no Spotify ap and no CD drive, are relatively minor and probably due to the fact that I'm coming from a Windows PC.  This device is great for minor, on-the-go work, but DO NOT rely on it as your primary computer.

Reviews.Title: Underpowered
Reviews.Author: Psnowden
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful product from HP. The device is great looking and seems well built. It wakes quickly and the battery life is adequate for an extended browsing session. However, the problems begin when you try to do more than a few things at once. For instance, Google advertises that you can listen to music via Google Music (which works fine) but once you open a second tab and start to scroll or interact with the second tab in any way the music stutters and has a hard time playing. I believe this is due to the choice of an older processor with a low amount of RAM. I could never get Pandora to load - it just refused and kept saying that "the music should have started by now!"Other "intensive" web apps such as Google's own Docs service struggle as well. This product could have been a great machine, the looks alone sold me; the performance however, is dismal.Bottom line - like an ex-girlfriend it looks great, but isn't too bright.

Reviews.Title: I simply like it and this is why...
Reviews.Author: TheUnboxingGeek-com "Bryan"
Reviews.Content: Why it's a better choice compare to other Chromebook?? - You can charge with USB cable. Forget the conventional power charging bricks that you need to bring along with other's brand Chromebook! - Stylish design. The other manufacturer simply use back the same old design from their laptop model and make it a chromebook.. You don't see this in HP Chromebook 11... - 6 Hours battery life! - and There should be a lot more strength on this little baby, I will try out this chromebook as my secondary laptop and update this review...stay tuned!

Reviews.Title: the black/black version is subtle
Reviews.Author: Jong Lee
Reviews.Content: the only color trim is the LED lights on the top of the screen.a nice step up from the Samsung option in terms of the understated design. a great secondary laptop.the micro-USB charger takes forever to charge via a standard charger, but still great to have the option!

Reviews.Title: HP Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Timm Peterson
Reviews.Content: I bought the Chromebook for my daughter knowing that the screen wasn't very big, however, when she was actually using it it is smaller that expected.

Reviews.Title: Love my Chrome book
Reviews.Author: Em
Reviews.Content: I have been using the Acer Chromebook for about 1 1/2 years. I love it.  Does everything I need it to do, even the built in cloud drive is compatible with MS Office.  Very convenient and for $199 you cant beat it. I had a tablet but did not like it. I really needed something with a keyboard and MS office compatibility.  It loads less the 20 seconds on start up.  Great product!

Reviews.Title: wedrftghyjukmnbvc
Reviews.Author: julia
Reviews.Content: It doesnt get skype or oovoo so therefore i wasnt as pleased to get it as much as i shouldve been.

Reviews.Title: did not like
Reviews.Author: lpalmer42
Reviews.Content: this is good for only opening 1 thing at a time, not like windows where you can open and do multiple things at a time, the size is nice, very thin and light but in this fast paced world, I need to have multiple things open and going at one time, so sorry chromebook you did NOT meet my expectations, also very confusing, was suppose to be 3G/4G but did not come that way, keep it!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Sounds good. but if u want to MS, Don't buy it.
Reviews.Author: Kwon Do Hyun
Reviews.Content: i thk it is so cheep, but i want to MS function. it isn't play .exe file.... for me it is so serious..;;

Reviews.Title: first hand experience---good but certainly far from great
Reviews.Author: Ben "the Doc"
Reviews.Content: well, first of all, it's a nice device. although looks a bit plastic and flimsy, it's actually pretty solid on hand.  And it's quite fast, thanks to the simple chrome OS.But there's also some issue:- from google side1. it does not allow you to use application specific password, so if you use 2-step password, you might need to login in periodically as it will log you off sometime2. there's no good way to link a conventional printer, which is not good. but you can get a cloud-ready one3. the one I bought here cannot register for the free 100g google drive for unknown reason4. missing right click function does hinder usage- from HP side1. there's no detailed instruction how to use this device. such as you need to use 2 fingers to scroll became an accidental learning2. no CAP key is not so convenient (was replaced by a search key)3. slightly wide gap at the monitor hinge (you can actually see the hinge)4. the screen cannot go 180 degree flat. so it cannot work if you sitting in certain comfortable position5. the one I purchased from Amazon had some wifi issue, also a visible pop-up on the touchpad----so I am returning it6. although CNET reports HP will have different color scent, but HP sales representative said they only made white/blue version, and will not make any other color ones, SUCK!Overall a very nice device, my wife likes it, but it can only carry certain task, don't expect it can work as a regular laptop. it's just something between laptop and tablet, close to netbook. The price tag shall be lowered to $200 in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: I hate it and couldn't return so I'm stuck with it!
Reviews.Author: AnythingYellow
Reviews.Content: The very first day this thing arrived I was already disappointed! I contacted the seller right away and wanting to return it but seller replied I would get charged from 15%-50% of my purchase price (I paid $359.48 for the white/yellow color).Lesson for me, read all the description before buying online!This laptop is very light. Looks cheap. Made in China. There is no way to insert a memory card! That's the number 1 that made me hate this. I always like to insert memory card to my previous laptop so I could easily browse/edit pictures wherever I am. I usually do it when hubby and I are driving long trips, we live in Kansas. Unfortunately, I could not do it in this laptop, I will have to use a usb to plug to my camera then plug to the laptop, that is so hassle. One time I tried to do it and never again!
